# üéµ Gratte-ciel de publication TikTok via mots-cl√©s | Bright Data + Int√©gration Sheets

## üìù Description du flux de travail

## üîÑ Comment √ßa fonctionne

Ce flux de travail fonctionne √† travers un processus simple et automatis√© :

- **Saisie de mots-cl√©s :** L'utilisateur soumet des mots-cl√©s de recherche via un formulaire web

## üöÄ Instructions de configuration

### √âtape 4 : Configurer Google Sheets

### √âtape 5 : Tester le flux de travail

## ‚öôÔ∏è D√©tails de configuration

### Param√®tres de l'API Bright Data

## üìã Guide d'utilisation

## üîß D√©pannage

#### üö® Grattage ne d√©marre pas

## üìà Cas d'utilisation

## üîí Notes de s√©curit√©

## üéâ Pr√™t √† l'emploi !

workflow.name: TikTok Post Scraper via Keywords | Bright Data + Sheets Integration

nodes.name: Accepts keyword input from the user.
Sends keyword to Bright Data's Discover API to start scraping.
Checks the scraping status using snapshot ID.

parameters.content:
üü• 1. Form Trigger Node
üìå Purpose:

User submits a keyword input.

This starts the scraping process.

üü© 2. HTTP Request (Trigger Scraping on Bright Data)
üîó POST to Bright Data

Sends the keyword to Bright Data.

Triggers scraping using dataset ID.

TikTok keyword-based discovery initiated.

üü¶ 3. Snapshot Progress Check
üîç GET - snapshot status

Fetches the current snapshot_id.

Checks if the scraping task is finished (status == ready).

üü™ 4. IF Node (Check Completion)
üìå Condition:

If snapshot is ready ‚Üí move forward.

Else ‚Üí wait and retry.

üü• 5. Wait Node
üïí Delays by 1 minute

If snapshot is not ready, pause for 1 minute.

Then return to recheck loop.

üü® 6. Final Data Storage
üìå Google Sheets Integration:

Stores extracted TikTok data.

Includes all post metrics and profile info.

main.node: Checks the scraping status using snapshot ID.
Sends keyword to Bright Data's Discover API to start scraping.
Checks the scraping status using snapshot ID.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
